header.title: Election 2019 LIVE: Protesters storm Tory Party election launch ahead of Boris speech
header.subtitle: PRO-IMMIGRATION protesters have stormed the Conservative Party’s campaign launch event chanting “Boris Johnson hear our say, refugees are here to stay!”
header.postText: The group carried posters adorned with a photo of the prime minister and the words No to racism, no to Boris Johnson. 'They shouted Boris Johnson hear our say, austerity no way! as security guards rushed to the lobby of Birmingham's NEC centre to expel them.', 'The prime minister is expected to arrive at the venue shortly where he will give a speech later in the evening.', 'Earlier, Brexit Party leader Nigel Farage spoke of his strong desire to sway Mr Johnson on his decision to pursue Brexit with his revised deal.', 'Mr Farage pointed to past examples of how Mr Johnson had changed course and said he was hopeful he could persuade him to reconsider his deal and instead back a clean exit from the EU.', 'Mr Farage said: There is one good thing about Boris in this situation, he changes his mind all the time.', 'Twice he voted against Theresa May’s deal saying it would be a suicide vest around the neck of British democracy and on the third occasion he voted for it.', 'He is very good at moving around with the wind.', 'If we in the Brexit Party can get that wind strong that says we voted to Leave the EU and nothing less is good enough he will change and we will get there.', 9.57 pm update: Watson says decision to step down is 'personal, not politcal', 'Tom Watson has insisted his decision to step down as a Labour MP and deputy leader is to do wit h his personal life and not the in-fighitng in the party.', 'For the full story click here.', '9.39pm update: Chris Williamson resigns from Labour Party to stand as independent', 'Former Labour MP, Chris Williamson, has announced his intention to stand as an independent in the general election after being barred as a Labour candidate.', 'Mr Williamson faced outrage in February after saying that Labour had been  too apologetic  over allegations of anti-Semitism.', 'Earlier...

commentThread.commentText: We need a party that will deliver Brexit not dissect it until only Brino is left. Brexit Party

replies.commentText: You mean the Non Brexit Party, the ones doing their very best to discredit the Tories knowing that by slagging off Boris they may get more votes. I for one wont be joining the sheeples who idolise Farage the frog.

What happened to all those leave dates we didn’t actually leave. Are you a Corbyn supporter or something? The Tory’s have already had three years to do this and you think giving them another five will get it done, don’t make me laugh, it’s not even funny. The only sheeple are the ones who keep running back to their old parties to keep the others out. If people want this done and dusted they need to vote as they did in the EU elections and that will get it done.
From a position of zero seats in the polls behind the greens on one seat with only weeks to go, please tell us how they are going to deliver brexit.

commentThread.commentText: Regarding the scottish ref, we must all have a vote.  They are stopping us leaving but we cannot stop them staying within the UK.  Seems a tad imbalanced......

replies.commentText: And please don't come back with vote them out. If that were possible I'd be first in line along with many others to do so. Your comments are not taken lightly by true Scots.

We also want a vote to get rid of Westminster. No, not the English just their way of governing the country. However much I hate the SNP I will always give my nationality as British. Do not think all Scots are pro SNP but the likes of you and a national calling fir Scots to be drilled into the ground because you think you run the country needs to change.
Tricky for the English to drill the Scots into the ground when the majority of them live in and around London ?
So by your reasoning everyone in the EU should get a vote on whether Britain stays or leaves the EU.

commentThread.commentText: The PM has little choice but to bring that no deal back to the table.. That story is slowly unfolding against the Tories WA. More torpedoes on there way.

commentThread.commentText: I would say at least 35% of conservative MPs voted remain in the referendum and would vote to stop any real brexit , 90 % of Labour MPs back remaining in the EU, so my question is this if YOU voted to LEAVE the EU and like me, you still want to leave then why oh why would you vote for either of these parties, VOTE BREXIT PARTY !

replies.commentText: and hand Brexit and the government of the UK over to the communist led Labour Party

Two options Boris ditches the rehashed may's treaty and does a deal with the Brexit party or you so called leavers who are going to vote for the tory's  change your mind and  vote for a party that actually will leave the EU completely no ifs no buts. Because we Brexit Party voters will  not be swayed by project fear. So you choose split the vote by voting for Boris and his surrender treaty or vote for the Brexit Party with us!
And waste my vote, I don't think so. The Non Brexit Party, nothing going for them and no future. No trade deals, No leader and only the one policy but another lot of snouts in the trough.

Did you vote to leave the EU ?  and if so you can't tell me that your happy with the way the Tories have failed us for over three years ! Don't worry about Corbyn he's a non starter, the Brexit Party will get us out and you talk about a lack of policies but the other parties don't stick to their manifesto's anyway what about the we will honour the result of the referendum lie that both Labour and the Conservatives spouted at the last election, the old parties have lied to us again and again   time for a change VOTE BREXIT PARTY if your sick of the same old lies !

What on earth is a 'real Brexit'? Rees-Mogg says Boris' deal is Brexit, Farage says it's not, Aaron Banks says it is, Widdecombe says it's not. If Brexiteers themselves can't agree on wha t Brexit is, how is anyone else to know?
A real Brexit is where we leave every part of the EU, laws , fishing  quotas  , free movement etc etc !
It's the old problem of splitting the vote.
Then don't split the vote join us  vote  BREXIT PARTY !
No Thanks, i'm not an ex labour voter.
Sadly our First Past The Post system gives us no alternative than Labour or Tory - so seeing as the Tories at least have a Brexit based deal on the table it has to be a vote for them.
Defeatist !
Fantasist
Why ?

All 3 main parties ha that in their 2017 election manifesto's yet Labour with Thornberry,  Stamer, Abbott etc ignored it, and the Tories with Clarke, Hammond, Soubry etc did the same.  Soubry may have left the Tories but got herself elected on their manifesto
Any deviation from the manifesto should automatically trigger dismissal from the Party and immediate by- election. People should be able to rely on what they vote for!!

When the last lot came round in 2017 I told them I was pro-Brexit which was the trigger word for them to run away.

commentThread.commentText: The only reason BoJo pushed for a revised May´s Deal was because of MP´s rejection and if he wins a outright majority he with NOT deliver Brexit and only BINO. The only Party who will deliver BREXIT is th e Brexit Party. With the other party´ s, we will have years more of tedious discusses and more giveaways Money, Fish, NI..... I have lost trust and faith in the Conservatives and Liebour are even worse, whilst the LibDem´ s will not respect democracy and take us in to MORE Europe and the euro, political alignment, army...... Lets get OUT and vote for t he Brexit Party.

replies.commentText: Totally agree

Please Explain to me why Boris's deal is Brino Only, after the Transition period, we become a independant, self governing nation, free to do ANY Trade Deal we want, out of the customs union, out of the ECJ, out of the Single Market, no freedom of movement, what part of all that is BRINO? You do understand the Withdrawal Agreement drops away after the implementation period? and we will end up with a Canada Style Free Trade Deal or similar? But go ahead, split the vote and put Corbyn and the SNP's in, and watch whats left o f Brexit dissapear for 5 years.
Tell all that nonsense to the people of NI who will still be stuck in until Stormont releases them.
The constitutional position of Northern Ireland is protected by the GFA.

GFA did not predict Brexit or Johnson's WA.  As it stands NI would be subject to different trade rules to the rest of the UK, and so subject to different EU laws and EU jurisdiction, thus its constitutional position will have radically changed if the WA is implemented.

blockquote class="spcv_blockquote">and we will end up with a Canada Style Free Trade Deal or similar/blockquote>Are you sure?  I think you need to read the fine print.  As for the undefined transition period, we sacrifice all sovereign rights, and have absolutely NO say in the EU legislation that we will be bound to follow.  Not forgetting of course the role of the EUCJ.  The WA takes us into EU vassalage and as clichéd as the term has become, it is no less untrue. blockquote class="spcv_blockquote"> ‘It is absolutely unbelievable that a country like the UK, which was the first country to accept independent courts, would subject itself to this..' ie, continued subservience to EUCJ rulings/blockquote>Dr Carl Baudenbacher Swiss constitutional lawyer

For the transitiion period yes, and whats the problem with that, if its leads to Brexit? My god we have waited 3 years now, how is another 3 max going to kill us, during which time, we will still have Free Trade and during that time, we can start putting the wheels in motion to get Trade Deals in plaec with other nations. You think America is going to be resolved overnight anyway, if we left with WTO tomorrow?, no its not, that alone will take 12 to 18 months minimum to put in place, so why not kick off the american negotiations and keep Free Trade with the EU whilst we are doing it? You say the Transition period is undefined, thats not the case, its 1 year, with the option of a 1 or 2 year extension, but with the conservatives now saying, end of December 2020 or we leave on WTO.

I applaud your optimism but BoJo can not be trusted, just look at the last 3 years. With no guarantee to the deal after the transition i would prefer to take WTO and a deal from that position.  BoJo´ s WA is the same as May´ s but she would not accept the border down the Irish Sea.
Don't split the vote then, vote for the Brexit Party and get to leave the EU immediately   and save a minimum of £39 billion!

The vote is going to get split, because the over 65's are Boris all the way, people like me are not going to change that. People need to recognise the polls, and the fact the Brexit Party are tanking on 10%. I was Brexit Party for a long time, but Nigel Farage not standing, says a lot to me, his cosy in his LBC job. Its the threat of Nigel that gives us Brexit, not Voting for him.

So you believe the polls, didn't they predict a  remain win in the referendum and didn't they also predict a large majority for Theresa May in the last election , i think the polls are  underestimating the Brexit party vote by about 10% or more, they will pull votes from labour and the Tory party.This is an election like no other, this is the end of the two party system !

It's only common sense, want out of the EU? then  VOTE FOR THE PEOPLE THAT HAVE BEEN WORKING TOWARDS THIS FOR THE LAST 20 YEARS, The Brexit Party. The British people are at times their own worst enemy:-

Brexit Party is the only way to a complete departure from the eu.

commentThread.commentText: What a load of baloney Boris is spouting.  His deal is just May's deal under another name - it doesn't gives us all that freedom at all.  We are tied down and handing over billions whilst having no say.

All every body should do is remember over 3 1/2 ago and think long and hard about voting in the same MP's that were in the house of commons and government and just vote for a new party and leader, Nigel and the Brexit party.
Tory pledges and promises are arbitrary.

Boris has sacrificed far far too much to get the Remainer Parliament on his side. The General Election will change the landscape, but it needs honest MPs committed to Brexit - which is why I'll be voting for The Brexit Party.
The Expression just gets it's 'news' from other newspapers and Twitter these days, lol!

Tim Bowling has thrown in the towel - he should have stayed with the Brexit Party, cos Boris's feet need holding to the fire. Boris = BRINO, and his money-for-nowt WA will be watered down by the EU and Remainers when it's negotiated. Stand your ground Nigel. I'm voting for Th e Brexit Party.

The Tories are not a Leave party, and any Leaver who votes for the Johnson Surrender Treaty will regret it for a very long time, and will not be able to complain when all its restrictions become apparent to those who have not read it. A Tory minority government relying on the votes of 30 to 50 Brexit Party MPs is what we need to hope for.

The Brexit Party campaigners should be knocking on every door in GB telling the working class that 5 decades ago we were deceived and lied into the EEC. The document FCO30 / 1048 was buried under the official secrets act. A 1971 civil service report predicted the EEC was heading to become a EU government and a central state ruling laws over GB and reduced our independent Country too just a federal region and Westminster reduced to a federal central chamber to carry out Brussels supreme laws and legislation! This shocking document coming to light should be on every main stream media but it’ s not and that should make patriotic Brexiteers even more angry and determined to leave the EUSSR!

The usual Corbyn Momentum storm troopers. I must admit they are well organised but who has paid for the nice neat Socialist Worker posters. People who HATE Britain and wish to change our way of life,as usual.
A clean exit automatically triggers trade talks, and during those trade talks the EU will want to avoid charges on goods because those charges put them at a financial disadvantage.
6 people chanting..'Refugees here to stay'..and I will leave it at that..
In all honesty how can anyone trust any of the last bunch of MPs again? We need new blood in our parliament not our current career politicians who are only there to feather their own nests.
1st Tory lie The 11 - page note says the pledge to stand up for Brexit is unnecessary because a Conservative government with a functioning majority will immediately get Brexit done”.

We are paying the price for major mistakes and enduring governments that have failed to even stem inequality. The mistakes would include multiculturalism, a poor immigration policy, and a much flawed and outdated political system. Brexit has shown us how our political system can be bent and abused and how democracy can be manipulated or even ignored. We are poor when it comes to caring for people despite the fact that we have millions of good and caring people. Politicians serve themselves far more than they serve the people.

We're only making plans for Nigel. We only want what's best for him. We're only making plans for Nigel. Nigel just needs that helping hand. And if young Nigel says he 's happy. He must be happy. The problem with basing any political campaign on a particular personality is that when said individual is seen to be weak, flip flops and has clearly sought to mislead the Electorate about his real political position concerning Brexit.....he is done for in the eyes of the Electorate, and no amount of apology and polishing can polish out the stains.

Farage unveils secret plan______Can't be secret if he has unveiled it...! The best time to ditch the withdrawal agreement would be when the trade deal negotiations fail and no deal becomes the only option left to us.

replies.commentText: The trade talks will only begin, Foxxx, once we have left the EU.   They want the 39 billion before they will start the trade talks, with no guarantee of the outcome.

I don't think you can just "ditch" a treaty, once it's signed. I know the Third Reich did, but that's a bit more extreme than I'm hoping we'll need to be. We just need to avoid signing the treaty in the first place.
